question.body: Which of the following can increase blood pressure by increasing blood volume?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Epinephrine plays a role in dilating the arteriols to increase blood flow to prevent even higher blood pressure.
Incorrect. ANP decreases blood pressure by reducing blood volume by excreting more salt.
Correct. Aldosterone acts on the kidneys to increase the reabsorption of sodium ions and water which increases the blood volume and blood pressure.
Incorrect. Erythropoietin is secreted in response to low oxygen levels and the need for more red blood cells.
